item.title: Past Projects
item.description: Cornell MFE SP'22: Using Financial News Headlines for Stock Price Predictions Used NLP and machine learning methods to predict stock, industry, and index returns from a dataset of financial news headlines. ORIE-5740 (Statistical Data Mining) SP'22: Constructing Optimal Portfolios using Hierarchical Clustering and Bayesian Shrinkage Applied Bayesian shrinkage to hierarchically clustered stocks to generate higher-performance porfolios. ORIE-5370 (Optimization for Finance) WN'21: Predicting Stock Prices Using COVID-19 Data

item.title: About
item.description: I am a current Masters in Financial Engineering student at Cornell University (‘22), interested in working at the intersection of finance and technology. I obtained my Bachelors in Electrical Engineering at the University of Michigan (‘21), with minors in Computer Science and Mathematics. I am an incoming summer intern at Beacon Platform, an NYC-based fintech startup. I have previously interned at Ford Motor Company as a Research Engineer Intern (‘19, ‘20) and at New York City Transit as a Software/Electrical Engineer Intern (‘18).
